website_summaries.verdict: The Moab 2 Ventilator sports day-one comfort, support, and versatility in a reasonably priced package. This Merrell hiker also receives great acclaim and applause for having excellent longevity and superb overall aesthetic.However, its list of commendable features reveals a couple of setbacks, mainly because of its heel slippage. Its scrawny stock insole didn’t help bump its reputation either. To conclude, considering its slew of satisfying features, the Merrell Moab 2 Ventilator is still worth checking out.
pros: A couple of experts give the Merrell Moab 2 Ventilator a high rating for its fantastically grippy outsole
It performs well on backcountry hikes and city walks alike, according to an abundance of users
A lot of wearers commend its stellar level of comfort
Hordes of consumers find their Merrell Moab 2 Ventilator hiking shoes pretty easy to break in
Droves of outdoor enthusiasts appreciate its affordable price tag
Numerous adventurers like how well the Moab 2 Ventilator supported their arches
Its astonishing durability makes believers out of dozens of verified owners
Even those who just bought it couldn’t express well enough their confidence in its long-wearing construction
A good number of patrons laud the hiker’s incredible lightness
cons: A significant percentage of Merrell loyalists are crestfallen as they experienced heel slippage due to the lacing system’s insufficient number of eyelets
A handful of wearers are not at all impressed with the shoe’s breathability
The men’s Merrell Moab 2 Ventilator receives criticism from some adventurers for its not-so-cushy default footbed
Width-wise, a small group of testers find the hiking gear a little on the restrictive side

customer_reviews.title: Excellent shoes with design faults
customer_reviews.text: When I first got these, i would have scored full marks. However, as a previous comment the laces are really stupid, they do not keep tied you have to double knot them which I think looks naff. The second design fault is that they are like walking on ice on some surfaces - anything metal, you could be up in the air. These two design faults are an inconvenience, but the comfort and fit is amazing - they are small fitting, i am 8.5, but a 9 fits perfectly. They are so comfortable you could walk miles. they look great too I cant believe how Merrell - i'm a big fan can get the basics so wrong???
customer_reviews.author: ToGO

customer_reviews.title: do not buy
customer_reviews.text: i used these to walk to and from work about 2 miles a day and the sole detached itself from the shoe in the rain and let water in to soak my socks after wearing them for six weeks, i am very disappointed as i have worn Merrells for years store bought and never had an issue with them, i would not recommend buying these shoes to anyone at £58.00 i am not happy.
customer_reviews.author: tim donovan

customer_reviews.title: Good but not that good...
customer_reviews.text: I initially ordered a size 10 1/2 but returned them for a 10 which were a better fit. However, the insole was not glued in perfectly: there was an uncomfortable area where the glue had not been applied evenly. For this reason, I returned them, feeling rather disappointed. I have had several pairs of Merrell trainers which were very comfortable and well made but these walking boots were not up to the usual standard. I eventually found a very good pair of Ecco boots that tick all the boxes.
customer_reviews.author: Art

customer_reviews.title: This New Version Has Spoiled a Great Shoe.
customer_reviews.text: Very Clumpy Shoe Now. Sole unit is much more rigid and Not as comfortable as the original MOAB.
customer_reviews.author: Knoxy

customer_reviews.title: It's the build quality
customer_reviews.text: Several years ago my son, who is in the trade, told me that if I wanted a pair of quality walking trainers I should get a pair of Merrells. I took his advice and this is now my 7th or 8th pair, of which 5 are still in use (sandals, blaze sieve, hiking boots, hiking shwes x2). These are of the usual quality and comfort levels I have come to expect and although Merrells are not cheap IMHO they offer the consistent longevity due to their exceptional design and build.
customer_reviews.author: Geoffrey Carter

customer_reviews.title: Not Waterproof at all
customer_reviews.text: In the product description, it says 'keeps moisture and debris' out. Not true. Twice now I've walked through fields in the very early morning for sunrise photography. Within minutes my socks are soaked. Thankfully I've only been out for a couple of hours so able to suffer the damp/cold feet. If I were out all day, in wet socks it would be a different story. I'm past the return date so it looks like these will be used for daytime dry weather and I'll need to splash out on a pair that actually do keep moisture out. They are comfortable and good for hiking - if the weather and conditions are favourable to you.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Andrews

customer_reviews.title: Improved Moab vents? Yes, please!
customer_reviews.text: My older pair of Moab Vents unfortunately gave out. The replacements are definitely welcome. Inexpensive, with better heel padding and arch support. After a couple of short hikes, they've molded well to my soles and are extremely comfortable. The laces do seem a bit shorter, but long enough.
customer_reviews.author: Pádraic Brady

customer_reviews.title: They don't want to break, in any way!!
customer_reviews.text: I have them for about 2 years now and I got bored with them, wear them about 5 times per day but nothing is failing about them. I want to buy something different but I don't feel comfortable throwing away a pair of perfectly good shoes that they just don't want to tear in some way.
customer_reviews.author: Cosmin Dina

customer_reviews.title: Comfy as slippers
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable and light on the feet, I haven’t got them wet yet so I’m not sure how waterproof they are, but, having said that I always wear waterproof socks if I’m walking on wet ground or in dodgy weather conditions, nice shoe which seems to be well made and great value.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Gee

customer_reviews.title: Too narrow
customer_reviews.text: These were bought for my dad who has bunions and wide feet. Bought these as he is on his feet all day and has to walk a lot for his job and has Merrell shows in the same size for winter. Unfortunately these were too narrow. They seemed nice enough otherwise but had to be sent back the same day.
customer_reviews.author: SoniM

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking shoes and are comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking shoes and are comfortable.. I bought one size up (10UK) after reading reviews here on Amazon. Unfortunately, theres a bit much toe space tbh. EDIT: I got a size 9UK in these and they fit perfectly. So I personally would recommend getting a size 9uk if thats what you normally wear.
customer_reviews.author: SmellyBongWater

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant
customer_reviews.text: I love Merrell shoes, so this may come across as a biased review, but I love them with good reason as they are superbly comfortable, and at the same time hard-wearing. I have yet to be disappointed with any pair I've bought, and these, my 3rd pair of MOABs, are no exception
customer_reviews.author: Rob Mountford

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality, did not require 'breaking in' no hot spots or sores. I used them walking in the Austrian mountains, I would recommend for beginner to intermediate level.
customer_reviews.author: PA Smith

customer_reviews.title: tried and tested
customer_reviews.text: second pair i bought, last April had a pair for Treck to the great wall of china, lasted a year, always wearing them, and i would recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Mr D V B Allen

customer_reviews.title: Durability is rubbish
customer_reviews.text: Merrell are sadly going downhill, They fit me perfectly, but the durability is shocking, I have yet another pair that have split around the toe area, it's good that they have been replaced (2 pairs up to now and a third I am still wearing have split) I buy them because I know they are comfy straight out of the box, but I am growing tired of returning them.
customer_reviews.author: David A Cook

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied ... Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with these walking shoes. I am thinking of buying another pair in case thy stop the production. m@rc
customer_reviews.author: Marc Larose

customer_reviews.title: Walking shoes
customer_reviews.text: This is the fourth pair of these boots that I have bought. They are very comfortable and can be used for in many different ways.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Loat

customer_reviews.title: Comfort
customer_reviews.text: First pair I have ever had and lovely and comfortable. Tried a 7.5 first but was too small so re-ordered an 8 and its perfect
customer_reviews.author: Mr Richard Bloor

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes.
customer_reviews.text: This must be the 6th pair of Moabs I've owned and I've never looked back, they're just really excellent shoes.
customer_reviews.author: James D. Henry

customer_reviews.title: I have always like Merrell's shoes and trainers and these are as good ...
customer_reviews.text: I have always like Merrell's shoes and trainers and these are as good as always. My only issue is the short life some models have - I find a really good one and they immediately stop producing it!
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable walking shoe
customer_reviews.text: This is my third pair of Merrells good fit and very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: David Prescott

customer_reviews.title: Quality hiking shoe
customer_reviews.text: Good solid comfortable walking shoe, but mostly for dry weather. If you take a 10 get 10 and a half. The laces need double tied or they just loosen.
customer_reviews.author: Jayenntee

customer_reviews.title: Very Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Fits very well, my usual size is a 12.5 UK but after reading reviews as well as experience from other Merrell products I have owned I went for size 13 UK instead. This was a perfect fit. Downside is that I have ordered these shoes for hot climate conditions and it does feel a bit warm.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality walking shoes and at the time of purchase a good price. Comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Bee

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Done a lot of miles in these now and they are the best
customer_reviews.author: steve

customer_reviews.title: Great fit, very comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: Great walking shoes, only problem is not very waterproof, even when walking on wet grass
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Euro size equivalent snug fit.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased UK size 8.5 / Euro 43; compared to other footwear in Euro size 43, they fit slightly small. Consider upsizing to Euro 44 if you normally purchase Euro size 43.
customer_reviews.author: nar

customer_reviews.title: Vent originals were great.
customer_reviews.text: Heel brutally hard even on home carpet just trying on. The original Vent was perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Hello

customer_reviews.title: A good value shoe.
customer_reviews.text: I get on with these shoes very well. They last me a good year year. I hope they keep making them.
customer_reviews.author: A. W. Wakefield

customer_reviews.title: Merrell mk 2
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with my purchase. Very good quality as usual. I need to go one size up on Merrells. They are similar to the mk 1. and good service from the supplier. Regards Mr a** y
customer_reviews.author: a s p

customer_reviews.title: Light and easy to wear.
customer_reviews.text: Bought the first pair of Merrell for my son. He is wearing them almost everyday and has tried them in many different terrains: from urban to mountain. The shoes are as expected: light and easy to wear, protecting your feet in hard terrains. He is very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Epaminondas

customer_reviews.title: GREAT  BOOTS
customer_reviews.text: This pair of boots are the third pair my husband has purchased. He finds them great
customer_reviews.author: Avril

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Another Great Pair of Hiking Boots (Shoes) For a Great Price. Very Comfortable and Well Made!
customer_reviews.author: Geoffrey N.

customer_reviews.title: Super comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: I've had these before. Very comfortable, I like the brown colour!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and supportive
customer_reviews.text: This is my fifth pair, I have fallen arches and they support my feet well.
customer_reviews.author: Heartland Home Services

customer_reviews.title: Great outdoor shoes
customer_reviews.text: Am on my 4th pair now. Good for people with narrow fitting feet.
customer_reviews.author: Dave.G

customer_reviews.title: Great boots, smaller than usual size
customer_reviews.text: Great quality boots and comfy. However the sizes are smaller than usual. I'm usually a UK 8, I bought a 9.5 so I could add more insoles, but they just fit.
customer_reviews.author: Sophie

customer_reviews.title: Fantastically comfortable shoes. Good wide toe-box for those with wider ...
customer_reviews.text: Fantastically comfortable shoes. Good wide toe-box for those with wider feet. Got a long haul hike in the near future and will add further reviews when done.
customer_reviews.author: fox

customer_reviews.title: Order the right size
customer_reviews.text: We ordered the size bigger as thought we needed extra space but they were too big so ordered actual size and fit perfectly
customer_reviews.author: hannah

customer_reviews.title: Size fit is correct
customer_reviews.text: Great boot very comfy size just right and not tight fitting.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Kenneth Egan

customer_reviews.title: Low grip when wet.
customer_reviews.text: Good looking shoe, but very slippery when wet under foot. Dry use only. Inner sole came loose very quickly but still useable.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Quick delivery.
customer_reviews.text: This is the fifth pair of Merrells I've bought from Amazon and they didn't disappoint.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very narrow fitment
customer_reviews.text: Fit is very narrow meaning that rub causing blisters. Take a long time bed in.
customer_reviews.author: Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Value for money.
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased, comfy and just what I was looking for, and very reasonably priced.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good fit
customer_reviews.text: Merrell usually have a small fit, so you have to get a size (or half) larger. But these were a good fit, so just get your regular size. Very comfortable. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Alfie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit, comfortable and arrived very quickly
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I expected. Perfect fit, comfortable and arrived very quickly. Not the first Merrells I've purchased and won't be the last.
customer_reviews.author: IanM

customer_reviews.title: Best ventilated walking shoe
customer_reviews.text: Good quality, nice fit, excellent value. Perfect for an all-purpose, ventilated walking shoe. Merrill have upped their quality.
customer_reviews.author: PMK

customer_reviews.title: A Great All Round Joy To Walk in
customer_reviews.text: A very comfortable fitting shoe with hardly any breaking in .
customer_reviews.author: Youk

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Great product which arrived on time and in top condition, good value for the price paid.
customer_reviews.author: michael o'reilly

customer_reviews.title: These boots weren't made for walking!
customer_reviews.text: Good fit but as I've had 3 pairs of the earlier version of these, they've changed the thickness of the instep or something in the moab 2's, after just an hour of walking they are really uncomfortable on the soles of your feet. time to find another brand I'm afraid.
customer_reviews.author: Johnnyjohn68

customer_reviews.title: Buy the next size up
customer_reviews.text: Make sure you buy a half size up, especially if you have wide feet. I'm an 8 and I bought an 8.5. I wish someone outside of the USA would stock the wide fitting ones.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: New is not better
customer_reviews.text: I seem to be in a minority but I prefer the original design. The soles on these seem much harder and I had sore knees after a week of wearing them. After about 10 different pairs of the originals I think I'm looking for a new favourite now sadly.
customer_reviews.author: C. Shephard

product_meta.title: Merrell Men's Moab 2 Vent Low Rise Hiking Boots
product_meta.description: These Moab 2 Ventilator shoes from Merrell feature performance suede leather and mesh upper along with protective rubber toe cap. Bellows, closed-cell foam tongue keeps moisture and debris out. These shoes also feature Merrell M select fit. Eco+ blended eva contoured foot bed with added zonal arch and heel support. Merrell air cushion in the heel absorbs shock and adds stability the outsole is made out of vibram Tc5+ sole. Experience comfort in these ventilated hiker. With durable leathers, a supportive foot bed, and vibram traction, all in a versatile package.
feature_bullets: Molded nylon arch shank with protective rubber toe cap
Bellows closed cell foam tongue keeps moisture and debris out
Box contents: One pair of moab 2 vent low rise hiking boots
